title: How has someone stopped addiction for good and had it work extremely well? - Quora

response.answer_text: There isn't a cure for addiction so stopping an addiction for good is not realistic. In my opinion, no matter how much clean time one has, as addicts we are all susceptible to relapsing. Major life events such as loss of a job, divorce or breakup, financial hardships, death of a loved one, health issues, and so on will surely test our sobriety. From my observation, the recovering addicts who have been able to weather the storms are those who have transformed their lives, tamed their egos, and adopted a spiritual practice or religion. Most do this through one of the 12-Step Fellowships.

There is this book written by Michael Lewis, who is in his late 60's and was an addict to heavy drugs for about half of his life and then went clean, earned a PHD and is a prestigious professor. In his book, he tells his personal history of how he stopped addiction for good, and it wasn't easy at all, but he did. Here is a review I wrote about that book: a review of Memoirs of an Addicted Brain: A Neuroscientist Examines his Former Life on Drugs
